means: 废弃的， 无用的， 荒芜的

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"废物，垃圾"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: waste, garbage, rubbish, litter, debris, junk
means: waste ： 普通用词，概念广泛，指任何被丢弃的东西。
garbage ： 主要指有机废料，包括厨房的剩菜剩饭或不能再用的食物。也可作引申用。
rubbish ： 普通用词，指任何成堆的、破损的、用过的或无用的东西，尤指弃掉的垃圾堆。也可作引申用。
litter ： 是四下乱丢物品的总称，尤指散落于地，有碍观瞻的废物。
debris ： 着重指分解、分裂或破坏后剩下的碎片，也指零散的普通废品。
junk ： 指回收的旧汽车或大型机器，也指毫无实用价值，或破烂物体，但不指垃圾。

word_mean: 消耗：躯体的逐渐耗损或缩小
排泄物：机体内不能进一步使用的无用材料
消瘦phonetie w.of the breath环杓侧肌麻痹性呼气过速

sentence.Network_en: Solid low-level waste will be disposed of deep underground.
sentence.Network_cn: 放射性水平低的固体废料将做地下深埋处理。

sentence.Network_en: They make compost out of all kinds of waste.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们用各种废料制造堆肥。

sentence.Network_en: Overcrowding has taxed the city's ability to deal with waste.
sentence.Network_cn: 人口过多使得城市的垃圾处理能力达到了极限。

jx.jx_en_mean: be unused or expended to no purpose

lj.lj_ly: a land laid waste by war.
lj.lj_ls: 被战争完全毁坏的国家。

lj.lj_ly: a land laid waste by war.
lj.lj_ls: 被战争完全毁坏的国家。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)a person perceived as useless or incompetent
(proverb)if you use a commodity or resource carefully and without extravagance you will never be in need
To gain or accomplish nothing by speaking.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 徒费口舌：费了口舌却一无所获

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old Northern French wast(e) (noun), waster (verb), based on Latin vastus 'unoccupied, uncultivated'

entry.def: If you waste something such as time, money, or energy, you use too much of it doing something that is not important or necessary, or is unlikely to succeed.

example.ex: There could be many reasons and he was not going to waste time speculating on them...
example.tran: 原因可能有很多，他不打算浪费时间对此妄加猜测。

example.ex: I resolved not to waste money on a hotel...
example.tran: 我决心不住酒店，以免浪费钱。

entry.def: Waste is the use of money or other resources on things that do not need it.

example.ex: The packets are measured to reduce waste...
example.tran: 包裹的大小经过测量以减少浪费。

entry.def: Waste is material which has been used and is no longer wanted, for example because the valuable or useful part of it has been taken out.

example.ex: Congress passed a law that regulates the disposal of waste...
example.tran: 国会通过了一项规范废弃物处理的法律。

example.ex: Up to 10 million tonnes of toxic wastes are produced every year in the UK.
example.tran: 英国每年会产生多达1,000万吨的有毒废弃物。

entry.def: If you waste an opportunity for something, you do not take advantage of it when it is available.

example.ex: Let's not waste an opportunity to see the children...
example.tran: 咱们别错过了看孩子们的机会。
这是一个错失了的良机。

entry.tran: （因不被接受、理解等而）浪费（建议等）；使徒劳无益
entry.def: If you say that something is wasted on someone, you mean that there is no point giving it or telling it to them as they will not appreciate, understand, or pay any attention to it.

example.ex: All the well-meant, sincere advice is largely wasted on him.
example.tran: 他对所有善意、真挚的建议基本都无动于衷。

entry.tran: (尤指市内或市郊的土地)荒芜的，荒废的
entry.def: Waste land is land, especially in or near a city, which is not used or looked after by anyone, and so is covered by wild plants and rubbish.

example.ex: There was a patch of waste land behind the church...
example.tran: 教堂的后面有一块荒地。

example.ex: Yarrow can be found growing wild in fields and on waste ground.
example.tran: 田野里和荒地上会疯长蓍草。

entry.def: Wastes are a large area of land, for example a desert, in which there are very few people, plants, or animals.
If something goes to waste, it remains unused or has to be thrown away.

example.ex: So much of his enormous effort and talent will go to waste if we are forced to drop one hour of the film...
example.tran: 如果我们被迫把电影缩短1小时，那么他付出的许多努力就会白费，他的才华也将大半被淹没。

example.ex: Mexican cookery is economical, she says. Nothing goes to waste.
example.tran: “墨西哥的烹调注重俭省，”她说，“任何东西都不会浪费。”

entry.def: If something or someone lays waste an area or town or lays waste to it, they completely destroy it.

example.ex: The war has laid waste large regions of the countryside.
example.tran: 这场战争摧毁了大片村庄。

example.ex: ...cities laid waste by the decline of traditional industries...
example.tran: 因传统工业衰落而没落的城市

entry.def: The expression waste not, want not means that if you do not use too much of something now you will have some left later when you need it.

example.ex: ...a nation that prides itself on its 'waste not, want not' thrift and its environmental conscience.
example.tran: 为其“俭以防匮”的节俭作风和环保意识而自豪的国家

means.word_mean: 1. any materials unused and rejected as worthless or unwanted;

sentences.sentence: "they collect the waste once a week"
"much of the waste material is carried off in the sewers"

means.word_mean: 2. useless or profitless activity; using or expending or consuming thoughtlessly or carelessly;

sentences.sentence: "if the effort brings no compensating gain it is a waste"
"a life characterized by thriftlessness and waste"

means.word_mean: 4. an uninhabited wilderness that is worthless for cultivation;
5. (law) reduction in the value of an estate caused by act or neglect

sentences.sentence: "He wasted his inheritance on his insincere friends"
"You squandered the opportunity to get and advanced degree"
"waste a joke on an unappreciative audience"
"We waste the dirty water by channeling it into the sewer"
"The water wastes back into the ocean"

means.word_mean: 5. get rid of (someone who may be a threat) by killing;
7. lose vigor, health, or flesh, as through grief;

sentences.sentence: "After her husband died, she just pined away"

means.word_mean: 8. cause to grow thin or weak;

sentences.sentence: "The enemy lay waste to the countryside after the invasion"
"Political prisoners are wasting away in many prisons all over the world"

means.word_mean: 2. located in a dismal or remote area; desolate;

auth_sentence.content: But what a terrible waste of a great band.
auth_sentence.res_content: But what a terrible waste of a great band.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But what a terrible waste of a great band.

auth_sentence.content: What a waste of time this hockey stick is.
auth_sentence.res_content: What a waste of time this hockey stick is.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What a waste of time this hockey stick is.

auth_sentence.content: They serve no purpose and will waste your time.
auth_sentence.res_content: They serve no purpose and will waste your time.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They serve no purpose and will waste your time.

Sentence.sentence: Yes, there is a trickle（涓涓细流）of biofuel（生物燃料）available, and more may become available, but most biofuels cause economic waste and environmental destruction.
Don't you think it's an awful waste of time?
They may regret the time they wasted.
Waste Not, Want Not Feeding the 9 Billion: The Tragedy of Waste
Furthermore, this figure does not reflect the fact that large amounts of land, energy, fertilisers and water have also been lost in the production of foodstuffs which simply end up as waste
As a global society, therefore, tackling food waste will help contribute towards addressing a number of key resource issues.

sentences.en: We must combat extravagance and waste.
sentences.cn: 我们必须反对铺张浪费。

sentences.en: It's a mere waste of time waiting any longer.
sentences.cn: 再等下去纯粹是浪费时间。

sentences.en: The river was thick with industrial waste.
sentences.cn: 这条河里淤积了工业废物。
我们穿过了没有树木的荒地。
快点儿, 我们别再浪费时间了。

sentences.en: The oil resources in some countries are rapidly wasting.
sentences.cn: 有些国家的石油资源正被迅速地消耗掉。

sentences.en: The long illness had wasted the old man's strength.
sentences.cn: 长期生病消耗了这老人的体力。

sentences.en: Long dry periods wasted the land.
sentences.cn: 长期干旱使土地荒芜了。

means.word_mean: 废弃的; 无用的; 荒芜的,未开垦的

sentences.en: This is a waste and useless tyre.
sentences.cn: 这是个废弃无用的轮胎。

jushi.english: They disposed of the the city's waste in the sea.
jushi.chinese: 他们把城里的垃圾倒入海中。

jushi.english: The city budget can afford no waste.
jushi.chinese: 该市预算担负不起浪费。

jushi.english: The explorers spent months in the Arctic wastes.
jushi.chinese: 探险家们在北极荒原上工作了几个月。
